instructions: Cut celery into small, thin pieces so they soften quickly.
tips: Mushrooms shrink when cooked, so avoid cutting them too thin.

instructions: Add 20g butter to a pot and heat on low-medium.
Add mushrooms, onion, and celery to the pot.
Stir continuously until softened and fragrant.
tips: Avoid high heat to prevent butter from browning too quickly.

instructions: Add the remaining 20g butter to the pot.
Sprinkle flour evenly over the mixture.
Stir continuously to form a smooth roux with no dry flour visible.
tips: A pale golden roux gives a mild flavor suitable for creamy soups.

instructions: Slowly add water and milk while stirring.
Mix until the texture becomes smooth with no clumps.
Bring to a gentle simmer while stirring periodically.
tips: Adding milk gradually helps prevent curdling.
Reduce heat immediately if bubbling becomes too strong.

instructions: Season with salt, white pepper, and black pepper.
Continue simmering until soup thickens to your preference.
Taste and adjust seasoning before serving.
tips: Blend half of the soup and return it to the pot for extra creaminess.
Top with parsley or croutons if desired.
